intro: Bidens aurea, commonly known as golden tickseed, is an annual flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers with dark centers, often surrounded by small, leaf-like bracts. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Bidens aurea is also known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
